title: Mirvac buys riverfront site in Milperra for 350 homes
text:
Mirvac has closed another acquisition for its next wave of development after snapping up the 18-hectare former Riverlands Golf Course in Sydney's west for the development of 350 new homes.

Mirvac's Stuart Penklis. Janie Barrett

It is understood Mirvac acquired the site from its current owners ASX-listed Abacus Property Group and private developer Demian Developments.

Mirvac will now forge forward to bring its development to bear, capitalising on its position near the future Bankstown fast-train metro station scheduled to start running in 2024.

The riverside landholding now named Riverlands Milperra was rezoned for low-rise residential development in 2016 and would be able to yield a housing community with amenities such as tennis courts, a pool and a barbecue area.

Mirvac aims to build a cycleway along the river for the local council with plans to complete the project in 2025.
description: Mirvac snaps up the 18-hectare former Riverlands Golf Course in Sydney's west for the development of 350 new homes.
